catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 910
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: shallow white dish with gently scalloped edges; waving incised lines on outside, resembling lotus flower; pink spots
text: Although it was originally intended only for elite patrons, the increasing popularization of porcelain over the fifteenth and sixteenth centuries led to the eventual decline and end of Buncheong ware. Carved lines on the exterior of this bowl and its lobed rim suggest the shape of a flower.
title: Flower-shaped dish
